result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Philip J. Gourley was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Philip J. Gourley was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Philip J. Gourley

records.addlTxt: for Revocation or Suspension of Huber   Approved  Revocation of Huber

Defendant Philip J. Gourley in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State addressed the furlough - makes arguement.  Atty Gramstrup addressed the Court and makes arguement - wedding is in Hayward, would accept conditions like doing UA's daily at his cost.  December 2, 2015 is his release date and he works at the casino 6 days a week, has had a number of UA's and has not had any hits.  Court questions Atty Gramstup.
COURT:  Furlough granted from 9/25/15 9:00 AM thru 6 PM on 27th on the 25th at 10:00 PM to report to Sheriff's dept. for a PBT and on the 26th to report at 11:00 PM at Sheriff's Dept. for a PBT  and sunday 27th to do a PBT at 8:00 am if comes back positive furlough is revoked.
in support of motion
notice of motion and motion for jail furlough

Defendant Philip J. Gourley in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup. John Yackel  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, DEF enters plea of NC to count 1 & 3 found guilty, dismiss and read in counts 2 & 4.  
Court withholds sentence on Count 1, 3 yrs probation.  Conditions of probation, revoke DL 33 months plus 1 year,   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.  IID for 33 months   On any vehicle owned or operated. Effective 3/23/15,   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations,   Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.    Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.  Fines/Costs $2200.00 forward $2500.00 bond to DOC, additional costs blood draw - Sheriff $22.15.  1 yr County Jail with Huber and good time, report 2/16/15 11AM, credit for 34 days.
Count 3, court withholds sentence, 3 years probation, conditions of probation 60 days county jail with huber, NO good time   Fine/costs $1158.00.

by atty TW Duffy  to withdraw request for bond modification
Bail/bond hearing on April 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING of his/her blood, breath or urine and shall report to the Sawyer Co Health & Human Services. 
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a stop case manager (715-638-3317) for the purpose of setting up a procedure to monitor compliance with the bond provisions.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
